Key Match Events: Chimwemwe Idana scored an own goal for Malawi in the 22nd minute
Chawanangwa Kaonga equalized for Malawi with a goal in the 31st minute
Jean Claude Girumugisha scored for Burundi in the 33rd minute
Lanjesi Nkhoma scored for Malawi with an assist from Kaonga in the second half
Mokono Elie Eldhino scored for Burundi in the 87th minute to seal the win
Post-Match Reflections: Burundi is currently at the top of Group L after the win
The Flames will travel to Bamako, Mali for their second Group L match against Burkina Faso next week
Malawi will face Senegal back-to-back in October
Burundi will host Senegal at BNS in October
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game ended with no further goals during the additional four minutes of play
